description: Nambukaragamage Nandasena alias M.P. Nandasiri    Vs   The Hon. Attorney General before Hon. Wickum A. Kaluarachchi, J.
parties: Nambukaragamage Nandasena alias M.P. Nandasiri    Vs   The Hon. Attorney General
keywords: When there are two indictments in two cases,  evidence led in one case cannot be adopted to the other. -Ingredients in a charge of rape and grave sexual abuse are different. -An accused charged for rape,  cannot be convicted for grave sexual abuse without giving an opportunity to defend. -Deprivation of the right to a fair trial. -Violation of the rules of natural justice. -No man shall be put in jeopardy by a mistake made by a court.-Factors to be considered in exercising discretion when ordering a retrial. -Retrial is not an appropriate order where time duration is substantial.
